channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Biden’s Broadband Bust
item.description: Not even one home has been connected with internet service as a result of a program the administration authorized for this express purpose.

item.title: Trump Should Immediately Stop Federal Agencies From Hiding Documents By Needlessly Marking Them Classified
item.description: Files should be open to the public unless otherwise specified, not secret by default. We the people have a right to know what our government does in o...

item.title: Repeal the Inflation Reduction Act
item.description: The law never had anything to do with inflation.

item.title: Could Vice President Kamala Harris make a run for California governor in 2 years?
item.description: Nearly half of voters in Vice President Kamala Harris' home state of California say they would be open to supporting her if she decided to run for gov...

item.title: Trump And Vance Should Immediately Push A Populist, Family-Friendly Agenda
item.description: Trump and Vance need to make dramatic populist moves now while GOP voters' appetite for economic libertarianism has dwindled.

item.title: Wisconsin GOP Senate Candidate ‘Shocked By What Unfolded’ On Election Night, Mulls Recount
item.description: Eric Hovde, who challenged Dem Sen. Tammy Baldwin in a tight race, is raising election integrity alarms after Milwaukee Election Day mess.

item.title: Gaetz resigns from Congress 'effective immediately' following attorney-general nomination
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson announced that Rep. Matt Gaetz, who was tapped by President-elect Donald Trump to run the Justice Department, issued his re...

item.title: Melania Trump launches 'On the Move' digital photo series highlighting her 'fast-moving life'
item.description: Former and incoming first lady Melania Trump rolled out a digital photography series to highlight her life on the campaign trail and at home.

item.title: Democrat to file resolution confirming Trump can serve only two terms as president
item.description: The 22nd Amendment already states that presidents can only be elected twice, but that's not enough for Rep. Dan Goldman, New York Democrat, who plans ...

item.title: The Left Should Learn to Love the Supreme Court
item.description: If Democrats are worried about stopping Trump’s overreach, the Court is their friend.

item.title: Republicans win 218 U.S. House seats, giving Trump and Republicans control of government
item.description: Republicans have won enough seats to control the U.S. House, completing the party's sweep into power and securing their hold on U.S. government alongs...

item.title: Voters Rejected Not Just Kamala Harris But Democrats’ Politics Of Division
item.description: A radical political and cultural realignment rejected superficial divisions, embraced American tradition, and made Trump our 47th president.

item.title: Democrats Went ‘All In’ on Abortion
item.description: It failed spectacularly.

item.title: Elon Musk dubs himself the ''George Soros' of the middle'
item.description: Wealthy business magnate Elon Musk likened himself to a centrist version of left-wing megadonor George Soros, casting himself as the "'George Soros' o...

item.title: In Trying To Generate Playoff Drama, NASCAR ‘Rigged’ Its Championship
item.description: NASCAR has dramatically altered its product in the hopes of retaining fan interest, but it has to live with the consequences of the changes it has wro...

item.title: Biting the Science That Feeds Us: The War against Fertilizers
item.description: ESG advocates who still believe their tactics lead to a better world should take a hard look at the harmful effects of their actions.

item.title: GOP wins House majority, completing Washington sweep
item.description: Republicans have won control of the House, cementing a trifecta in Washington and empowering the party to enact President-elect Donald Trump's agenda.

item.title: Rep. Michael McCaul says he was detained at Dulles airport over being 'disoriented'
item.description: Republican Rep. Michael McCaul, the chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, said he was detained by police at an airport near Washington, D.C...

item.title: California Democrat Josh Harder declares victory in House race
item.description: California Democrat Rep. Josh Harder has declared victory over his Republican opponent, Stockton Mayor Kevin Lincoln.

item.title: Trump attorney Alina Habba not considering press secretary role
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's senior adviser and attorney said she would not be interested in serving as press secretary for Trump's second term.
